title: Student Field Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: • Responsible for the installation of network switches, UPS equipment, the configuration of new data drops, along with other duties that help keep the campus network running. • Remove and replace equipment all around the UNT campuses.
Interview Questions: How well do you function in a team environment? Have you ever worked in an office environment?

title: Reserach assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Washington, DC) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: It’s good and need to be more to rate on specific questions. The time is also matters for the interview any one needs to consider that. No commitement towards the taking of candidate during interview.
Interview Questions: It’s hard to take up

title: Instructional Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed online with several professors and HR. Main professor to be hiring manager was not present. So when I had questions, the group didn’t have any answers to them or just didn’t understand my questions.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your tasks? How do you handle work when there’s several tasks to do?

title: Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: two interviews with two people each. One virtual and another one in person. Very friendly. It was more like a conversation. Fast response . Open and honest. Basic behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a micromanager supervisor?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: They use the STAR method. You must tell a story that entails the situation, the task at hand, the action, and actual results. This method can be somewhat difficult given that it puts you on the spot to think of an instance.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were faced with two equally possible decisions. Which did you choose and why?

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The good news is that the initial process was rather quick - after applying, I heard back and had a phone screening scheduled within a week. But the screening itself was pretty underwhelming. It was clear that the TA consultant was reading from a script, and while she did give me the opportunity to ask questions, she answered each question with "that would be a great question for the hiring manager". I understand the hiring manager makes the final decisions, but she should know basic information about the role, like whether it's hybrid or in the office full-time. After the interview, I had to follow-up twice and, after almost 3 weeks, I finally received the email saying they would not be moving forward.
Interview Questions: What would you consider your greatest strength?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Great! Open ended questions and efficient 45 minute phone screening. HR Recruiter took notes as I relayed my responses so no real banter or follow up questions to any of my responses , but is typical in a first interview. Process is SLOW though since it’s in higher education which is notoriously slow to hire and onboard for any non-teaching position.
Interview Questions: What are you most proud of up to this point in your career?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: A Group interview with supervisors and current student workers where each person goes around and asks a question, around 8 total questions. relatively standard questions but was quite much for just a student assistant job
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this job?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions:
I was phone interviewed initially for a brief understanding of my experience and the role.

Next was zoom interview with direct manager and manager above.

Last Interview was with the team. They asked me some questions about my experience and I asked them a lot about what the role is like.
Interview Questions: Do I have experience with Agile?

title: Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: You will probably not hear back for months. The job descriptions do not adequately cover the actual work, and the interview questions are typically not relevant. Most people at UNT end up doing whatever fell through the cracks elsewhere, or the duties of a position they decided not to backfill.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UNT?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were rude and unprofessional.  They were having side conversations and laughing while other interviewer was asking questions.  Overall not a welcoming experience and got the feeling the workplace would be equally clique-ish.
Interview Questions: How do you manage in a fast paced environment?

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really not that too hard, but as long as you know what you are doing, then you should be fine. After the interview, if you are a fit for the position, you will then be shown around the work area nd how things are properly done.
Interview Questions: Cannot remember the questions asked in the interview

title: Career Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: First half, we discussed my experiences and qualifications. Second half, consisted of role play where I demonstrated my strategies for career coaching with different faculty members from the college I would be working under. The faculty pretended to be students under some of the majors I would be serving.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my work experiences (and internship) for my bachelors degree which was a major under the academic college. I was also asked about my career coaching experiencing as a graduate assistant.

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Very formal, potential candidates with experience are a plus, but drive to work is especially important. Scheduling if you're a student is important especially with the amount of hours you want to work.
Interview Questions: Have you worked on a computer in terms of repair and troubleshooting?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews throughout the process.  It wasn't bad.  Offer came quickly enough.  Environment after the new changes is fairly toxic and not transparent.  New leadership leaves something to be desired.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in Higher ed

title: Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty easy, very competative process. You have to know your technical aspect of the interview, know your job description and what are basic requiremnt.
Adk for feedback and work on them.
Interview Questions: Scenerio based problem solving to the problem

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed directly with the professor of the group I applied to. The nature of the job was explained in great detail. Some discussion proceeded regarding my previous research experience.
Interview Questions: "Do you have experience in multiscale programming?"

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a panel interview that involved my direct supervisor, a student worker, and another employee that I would work with. It also involved a take home assignment to prove that I could actually do the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: There is a group interview and then a personal interview. Group interviews, test your ability to work as a team. The personal interview is to see how you would lead your, small group.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict with a team member?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions:
How will you help in working with professors?
Helped Professors in doing research
Proctored exams and helped  with various assignments with regards to research and development within the department 
Collection of assignments and grading them as well. 
Do you have any background in office use?
Interview Questions: What is economics and why do you like it?

title: Special Collections Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was super chill and casual. Felt more like a conversation rather than an interview. I got to meet some of the employees there and everyone was really nice and friendly.
Interview Questions: Do you a collector of anything?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Not worth the time to apply. Too many openings and when you do apply, you get an email saying all the positions are full. Better luck trying at another college.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Never received a formal interview. I was hired out of the adjunct pool without one. I did not even meet with the department chair or the coordinator until the first week when classes were to start. Was a bit off-putting actually.
Interview Questions: N/A. Since, as I stated, this practice of foregoing the interview happens at UNT apparently.

title: Academic Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Took a competency exam in the specific subject I was to be an assistant in. Then sat in with an in-person interview with the head of the department and the director of the assistant program and was asked general questions about competency and my relationship with my major
Interview Questions:
What do you plan to do after college?

Why did you choose your major?

title: Design Works Shop Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed first to confirm an interview time that suited my schedule. I then joined the interview via zoom. The interview was very relaxed and focused on my future goals and what I would want to get out of the position. I have never felt as comfortable in an interview, it felt more like a conversation. It was very professional but the interviewers we so incredibly kind.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
It's smooth, just show how you explain questions to the entry level college student and it's easy for me.
Actually i don't know what else to put, just common interview.
It took about 1-2 month starting from applying onHandshake and then email you for the interview and then do an interview.
Interview Questions: What will you do if you have some questions in your teaching?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Application + on-site interview with hiring manager. The interview included some basic questions as well as a skills assessment.  The hiring manager was very nice and knowledgeable - very welcoming environment! Overall simple and straightforward process.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite library you have visited, and why?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple, but had a paper test. The test was not so bad, but with limited time that hard to check when the test was done. No questions were allowed to ask during the exam.
Interview Questions: Why do you apply this position?

title: Student Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: A solid mix of simple and complex questions. Done over a Microsoft Teams Call. From start to finish the hiring process was relatively fast providing you the employee, get your forms and submit them on time.
Interview Questions: What steps would you take to obtain the IP address of an individual computer

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is a slow process between initial HR contact to interview with team of 4 managers at one time.   It took about 4 weeks for that time frame.   They each take turns asking you questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult employee?

title: Student Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied through Handshake and was contacted for an in person interview about a week later. The interview lasted about 10 minutes, and you take a simple assessment that quizzes you on your knowledge of technology (windows files, mac shortcuts, etc)
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Very Easy. I would say it would pretty straightforward. Just came in and they described the situation. Once they were done, then I was offered the job. But i declined.
Interview Questions: Would you like the job?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back the next month. I was then offered a phone interview with two people within the office. After the phone interview they informed me that they would ask to do a video conference interview.
Interview Questions: Why University of North Texas.

title: Teaching Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: The department chair and professors from different fields in the department will come to the interview. They will ask you about the research back ground, and you need to show a slides about the research experience. Then, they will ask questions based on the research experience you showed.
Interview Questions: They will ask you to show the researches you did in the past

title: Assistant Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: For faculty librarian positions, you will start with a phone interview of 10-15 questions. If selected for an in-person interview, it will be an all-day marathon. You will meet with several different representatives from different groups, the interview committee, the dean, have a lunch with a group you will likely work with (if hired), a dinner as well as a formal presentation (up to an hour long, including Q&A) to current employees - keeping in mind you're being evaluated by everyone you come into contact with, even if that's not explicitly stated. The search committee will ask 10-15 questions related to the position and your professional goals. The hardest part is maintaining a professionally sociable demeanor for 10-12 hours straight and not getting exhausted.
Interview Questions: If you could choose 2 professional development activities, what would they be and why?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Brief, about 15 minutes, wherein the office coordinator spoke about the duties and responsibilities of the position. Mainly asked if I knew about the International Studies Degree program (Pursuing the major, etc.), and then we talked about availability during classes for a work schedule.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in an office environment previously?

title: Shift Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Light hearted and they work with you. This program is a great one and they want you to succeed but you have to show that you’ll put in effort to get there.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone got injured on the job?

title: Assistant Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: simple and straight forward. Not many tricky questions and the interviewer was very nice and accommodating. Felt like I did a good job and was a very low pressure situation
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Clark Bakery Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back. The interviewer wasn't intimidating, the environment was very relaxed and the process was quick and to the point for the most part. They asked questions and answered my questions with a welcoming attitude.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
Have you worked on campus before?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Fast-paced interview with a focus on problem solving and adaptability. Questions tend to test the willingness of the employee to communicate with customers in a clear and effective manner. Candidates need to be clear in their thought process.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve an issue between manager and yourself?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply through their online platform. Very easy going and fast process. Communication was good and guidelines were easy to follow.  The whole process did not take too long.
Interview Questions: In what way have you contributed to your previous job?

title: Office Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great, I had a blast with my now coworkers! It went well, very smooth. The people in my department are great and they take time to ask questions that are serious but also asks questions that will catch you off guard (in a good way), the second interview was to meet the team and have a very chill tour around the office and see heo the vibe is with the whole team.
Interview Questions: If a penguin walked in a room with a hat on, what would it say?

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of two different interviews, one main interview and then a follow up interview. The interview consisted of both technical questions, general leadership questions, as well as asking about recommendations for what improvements I would make to the site.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript?

title: Cafeteria Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: short interview, not difficult. They asked a few questions. The interview process is not stressful and I don't believe you need previous work experience to get hired. The manager who interviewed me ate Kerr Hall was nice.
Interview Questions: have you worked at a restaurant before?

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Nothing to worry about, they are just making sure you have positive and kid attitude, they have a focus on good customer service for the students, you need some computer knowledge
Interview Questions: What  makes you right for this job?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: You do better getting a job here if you are a part of SGA. or join a program. I wouldn't go apply before showing you are a part of a club or something. You do better when you have an in with a high-ranking organization instead of just going in. And yeah, that's all I have to say I don't know what more this is a bad idea on Glassdoors part because people will just write whatever.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about Yourself?

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very basic and they asked about my computer skills.  They gave me a laptop and asked me where will you go to do updates. They were really nice and asked me mainly questions on my resume.
Interview Questions: What happens when a faculty system crashes

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a direct interview with the manager, I was asked to explain about my previous work experience and most of the questions were behavioural questions. Few of the questions were regarding the software used in the lab.
Interview Questions: How do you handle failure?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy, just wanted to know if you had cash handling experience. The rest of this is just to hit the 30 word minimum he haw jiggy shaw. Good job and good people to work with ya fell
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for this job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: First we submit the application, if our application is picked then we are called to schedule one. Then they will be for one hour face to face interview . The interview was a good experience. I was able to put out my thoughts on how I want to grow and learn as a graduate student .
Interview Questions: What do you think is the future of Data science ? Linux commands

title: HR Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Standard process with simple questions. Sometimes the process can take a long time. Normally there is a follow-up interview. Interviews can be with just one person or a panel. It depends on the job.
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you for the job?

title: Registrar Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty straight forward. Sent in my application and a few days later was scheduled an in-person interview for that following Monday.  During the interview, she stated that she will make a decision by Friday. Then proceed to ghost me. I never heard from them again despite several follow up attempts on my part. Very unprofessional!
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Interview was for 30 mins and it consisted of a casual conversation with the hiring managers. They asked general questions about the position applied and basic behavioral question. I was also asked to elaborate on the projects I have worked on.
Interview Questions: Explain what was on your resume

title: Office Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 4 staff at once. They were friendly but had lots of questions that seemed repetitive. Not sure how I did. Parking was insane.  Applied online and 2 weeks later was called in for interview.  What is your biggest strength? What's your biggest weakness?
Interview Questions: What would your coworkers say is your biggest weakness?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included multiple rounds, including group interviews where we did team exercises to see how well you worked with others and problem solved, and then individual interviews with Hall Directors.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Study Abroad Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: First a phone screening with UNT's Human Resources. Within about an hour of the phone screening i was notified that i was on to the next step of the process, an interview with the assiatant director of the study abroad process. This second step was scheduled about a week after the initial phone screening. About 3 or 4 days after this second phone interview i was invited to an in-person interview where i was able to interact with several employees within the department. The travel expenses were not paid, however i do think that even if i hadnt been hired it would have been a valuable experience to interview in person. A free lunch and coffee were given during the interview and interaction process which all together lasted around 3 hours. Overall a great interview experience. Everyone i interacted with at UNT was professional and kind. I was notified 4 working days after the in-person interview that i was hired. From start to finish the entire interview process took just over 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you think students should have an experience studying abroad while at university?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a face to face interview by manager, I was interviewed in a room in the university's library, Manager was friendly and the process was smooth .
Interview Questions: Which traffics signal would you prefer to be ?

title: Auxiliary Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online. I received a call to schedule a time and place to meet my interviewer. Waited about 15 minutes and was interviewed by the manager there about my job experience.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about the position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: interview felt like you’re back in school taking an exam. The questions were formal and short. Friendly environment. We talked  about the history of the campus and our visions for the future.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PDS Mail Service Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Quick and simple with the Manager. Nothing over the top and very clear on what is wanted. They gave a tour of the complex, acknowledged that it is a very repetitive doing job and you have to be able to do it all.
Interview Questions: Are you able to do repetitive motions for long periods of time?

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: No real interview I applied online and got a letter stating that they would like me to work for them.  There was a presentation over our responsibilities to our students and what was allowed. Talked about hours and looked mostly for mechanical engineers
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview starts with HR then another round with the chair/Administrator of the Department. I applied in November 11...got the offer on January 26. The HR interview was the hardest obstacle, with the second interview being fairly straightforward. It definitely helps to have staff recommend you.
Interview Questions: What software skills, what social media abilities, how long do you plan to stay?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and quick. I interview with two different people and heard that I got the position the same day. The interview didn't feel like an interview more of a conversation.
Interview Questions:
How long do you plan on working here?
Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Not much of an interview. It was more like the manager told me a description of what they do there and then asked when I was available. I left feeling confused as to whether or not I was hired.
Interview Questions: When are you available?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Short one round of in-person job interview lasting about 30 minutes to 1 hour with two hiring managers.  Very casual and friendly atmosphere during interview.  Met with other office managers, employees and staff.  Job offer was received within 1 week.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about your education.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was notified of an interview via the phone and a Skype interview followed. After the interview it took weeks of emailing faculty to get information from them after they told me they would get back to me in a week. HR is not helpful at all in notifying anyone about the status of your application. Very unprofessional. Just because this is an institution of higher education, does not mean that they are organized or progressive in doing their own jobs.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was for about 45 minutes and the interviewer was very friendly. Though I was nervous at first, the interviewer made me feel comfortable and that helped me in my interview even better.
Interview Questions: If you would be a traffic sign, which one would you be?

title: Administrative Specialist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Relatively basic process. Job was described. A series of questions was asked relative to the job role. I was also given the opportunity to ask questions. My interviewers were very down to earth and seemed like they were more engaged than just reading questions off a questions-to-ask-at-an-interview list.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you've utilized your strengths to overcome a work challenge.

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: nerve wrecking, but great because of how personable they were. Hall directors are friendly and want you to be comfortable. It was a 3 phase process. First phase, you're trying to stand out among several applicants and a few hall directors. Second phase they've narrowed the applicants down and you're basically doing the same. Lastly you sit down in a personal interview with hall directors of that dorm.
Interview Questions: what is your weakness?

title: Video Production Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy process. Expect to wait a while after applying to hear back for an interview. Was contacted for an initial phone interview, then told final candidates would come in for an in person interview. I did not make it to the final round.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous jobs and how that experience is relevant.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't tough though. They asked about educational background and any volunteering experience in past. They asked about some technical knowledge and checked English profficiency. Also asked about CAD software knowledge.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about manufacturing process?
What kind of machines do you know?
Have you ever used that?
What CAD softwares do you know?

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: You need to apply for the TA position in the online portal and you will receive mail after a month.The mail will contain the date and time of the interview.
Interview Questions: Basic questions on programming

title: Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick, clear job description, and friendly experience. The expectations of the job were laid out well and the challenges and benefits were clear. Additionally, the support and potential opportunities and challenges of the position were made clear.
Interview Questions: What was a time you had a challenging customer interaction??

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Dallas, TX) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: They asked me questions on on my teaching ability and research during the interview. I had to make a presentation on my academic research and meet with faculty for individual interviews.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach at this school?

title: Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very friendly. Your typical student job interview. They asked about my major, interests, and how I fit the job. Be prepared to show why you want the job and deserve it.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Asked me about my previous work experience as java developer and knowledge over web development and about my current projects. They also asked me my interests towards pursuing high level degree
Interview Questions: About Various Web technologies

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process takes 2 weeks after the interview. The interview was simple.  If you are an international student, you will be asked to an additional interview with an English instructor.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was hired because my professor referred me to the department I work for. They asked for my resume and I was immediately hired due to my being a graduate student, my involvement in education, and my research experience. The rule was that I work with a student who has taught in the past so that I have the support I need and the resources for training.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience I had. My involvement in my previous school. Why I wanted the position.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Asked me basic questions about design software and Engineering Drawings. I showed my project which i had done on the same software , I answered his questions about subject and He selected me.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with SolidWorks ?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was brought into a room of 5 people. It was an intimidation tactic. I didn't think much of the people that I interviewed with at the UNT business center as they were overly nice. I should have listened to my gut, because once they got me into the group, they started treating me like crud.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you found an accounting error?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met him in his office and he briefed me on what the job entails and what is expected of me. The  whole process didn't take very long. It was apparent they are looking for hardworking students who do not make excuses and take their jobs seriously.
Interview Questions: What is your class time table like?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was simple, first there was a phone call to confirm a 1:1 interview. At the interview a simple few questions regarding past experience and problem solving skills were asked. After the interview about 2-3 days later i received an email with an offer. The entire process took about 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: What kind of steps do you take to solve a problem?

title: Data Communications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: They talked about themselves and asked more about me. Took me to a closet to show how their networks were connected. Each interviewer asked a question and then handed me a sheet with more questions to fill out.
Interview Questions: How many colors did you see in the closet?

title: Part Time Champs Cafeteria Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy, didn't ask me much and just told me more about the job and what they expect from me. Basically said that the most important part was to have a smile on and never just wonder around, always be doing something
Interview Questions: Didn't ask me any hard questions at all

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: 30 mins interview at the Business leadership building with the hiring manager. If you have good commands in Excel, word, ppt. and if you can build queries in access, create the basic of the database, then there is good chance to clear the interview. Though the competition is fair enough.
Interview Questions: how do you create query in SQL

title: Help Desk Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very little technical questions, was mainly focus on personality.  The entire process took about a week, with only one interview. The interviewee was very nice and respectful. Overall a very enjoyable experience
Interview Questions: If a customer was complaining about their wifi not working, what steps would you take to fix it?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Only one round of interview with 2 full time employees in the library. One of the interviewer asked me to arrange a couple of books based on the Library of Congress (LOC) shelving method.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position online, i did not  even remember applying for it, I was called for the interview. Later i learnt that the position offers funding for international students. then i prepared really hard for the interview.
Interview Questions: Leadership roles,

title: IT Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was OK and they are so open and nothing unexpected it's so clear, but they need you to know a lot, so having experience will help you to pass otherwise it's hard to pass.
Interview Questions: What thing that you don't like about your boss?

title: International Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. My interviewer isn’t there anymore though. This is a review. Have I hit the minimum yet? I sure hope so. I’m just trying to read something else.
Interview Questions: It’s been years. How could I possibly remember?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions:
The first step was a phone interview. The supervisor asked many of the standard interview questions. Because of the level of the position, the supervisor focused on prior work experience as well. The supervisor was friendly, open and honest in answering questions and outlining the responsibilities of the position. 

The next step was a face to face interview. The first phase of the interview was a two on one where I was asked to provide details about my background and experience. The second phase was a panel interview with six other members of the team. Many of the same questions were asked, but it was a great experience to get to ask about their experience working there. The third phase was a creative test. It was challenging because you only had 30 minutes to complete the task.

Overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online; got a call 2 weeks later.... and then had an interview that lasted about 20 minutes... ... and then received the offer about 2 weeks later. The whole process was quick and the interview was very easy, no hard questions asked.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions?

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
3 rounds of interviews one with each manager and then one last working interview.

All were about an hour long and with each interview the team will gather information about you, so at the end of all three interviews the team will sit down with you, talk to you about what they saw what they liked and what you might need improvement on, which are all very basic and constructive so it makes it easy to grow.
Interview Questions:
Prior experience.
Degree.
5 year plane

title: Food Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Really Easy. They put you to work based on your class schedule. You don't need any prior experience & is a great way to get your foot in the door at the university for other jobs.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked retail

title: Special Events Director/Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hiring individual contacted me via social media and asked me to apply for position. Application was submitted, along with an email directly to hiring professional. Resume, cover letter, and references were provided. Follow-up email, phone call and messages produced no results for 2-3 weeks. The only response received was vial social media messaging telling me I did not make the final cut of candidates. Extremely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward questions and personable interviewer. Pretty average interview questions. Primarily just want to find out if you are a leader and can perform administrative duties along with building policies and procedures.
Interview Questions: What examples have you demonstrated leadership?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line at the schools website. I was emailed to schedule an interview, then went in that Thursday for an interview and accepted an offer before the weekend. Very easy mostly just a behavioral interview make sure you're decent.
Interview Questions: What does your schedule look like?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: It really depends on the professor. Some are very informal. Some take it very seriously. Depends on how popular their research lab is and the grants/funding they're receiving. If you're smart and you show you want to work hard for their research that a plus. If you show you could possibly bring more research grants to the table, that's excellent.
Interview Questions: What you do you think you can do after getting your graduate degree from my lab?

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: very long, took many days, phone interview as well as in person, multiple person, multiple panel interview, I had to prepare a presentation in advance so I was very nervous about that
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Easy going not bad at all 
2 days to here back
1 interview 
Work study job
Had fun learning 
Amaaaaazing 
Coool 
You won’t regret working here 
Great stepping stool to full time
Interview Questions: Why do want to work here ?

title: Multimedia Assistant for UNT Union Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: They just asked me a couple of get to know you questions and basic interview questions. I was super nervous because I had never really had a real interview before then, but they could sense that and created a comfortable interview environment for me to thrive in. They asked me to show some of my video work so I showed two short films I had made the previous semester.
Interview Questions: Do you have any After Effects experience?

title: UNT Astronomy Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very causal. I came into the office and asked if there were any open positions, and also directly emailed the manager at the time describing my interest in astronomy. I was asked to come in before the end of the week. The interview focused more on motivation and work ethic than specific skills. I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: Describe your interest in astronomy. Do you have a good work ethic?

title: Director of Sales and Marketing for Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met onsite with the Executive Director and Operations Director twice. We discussed my skills and past accomplishments, and they gave me a breakdown on what they were looking for. Then they gave me a tour of the campus and the dining locations. Very pleasant meetings. I enjoyed them. The Executive Director and Operations Director were very cordial.
Interview Questions: They asked about previous marketing programs I directed and how I can apply my skills to their needs.

title: Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: met with multiple people including the new finance leader. was told and all indications were positive, but there was zero followup from the department. After an email i was told they we still working on it and things were positive. no response after that
Interview Questions: prior examples of budgets and training, how to explain variances to people of different levels of understanding.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was sort of a hybrid group and individual interview it was very easy however it took forever I was waiting for 4 hours for a interview; I also knew other people there who stayed even longer than me as well.  It was a bit like being a captive audience.  The actual interview itself only took about 30-45 minutes.  The interview itself was good I just wished that they had scheduled it better so people didn't have to spend all day there.
Interview Questions: All the questions were very basic they were just looking to see your soft skills were mostly conversational.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of five people ranging from an admin assistant to a project investigator.  The questions were pretty basic, but also in-line with the requirements for the job.  They were very descriptive on what the expectations were for the job and what the best candidate would be.
Interview Questions: Describe your past experience working in grants at TWU?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: They call you to meet with the supervisor you will be working with. You will basically talk about the workplace culture, values, wages, and schedule. You will be let know what is expected of you. The second interview is with the manager who will give you a tour of the workplace and test your personality. The third interview is basically contract signing and terms explained.
Interview Questions: Can you stand for longer hours?

title: Career Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a smooth interview process, but it took 3 months to complete. I was screened with a phone interview through the Human Resources department. Then I was invited for an on campus interview. I was asked to present to the group on the topic of Career Development. Then had a one-on-one interview after the presentation.
Interview Questions: What are the key elements of successful career advising with college students?

title: English Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Very professional office, be sure to ask good questions. The lady who ran the interview did a good job of making me feel welcome and relaxed. I am certain she would be a nice person to work for. They place an emphasis on education. The person who ended up getting the job was a graduate student.
Interview Questions: Questions were pretty standard stuff. I don't remember anything specific.

title: Student Services Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on Tuesday. Received a call for an interview on Thursday. Met in office on Monday.

One thing I do not like about interviewing with UNT is, once you apply and interview, if you are not chosen you NEVER hear from them again. No follow up phone call or e-mail letting you know you were not selected. You must sit in agony until a generic e-mail from HR is sent. (which sometimes never even comes, if it does its 2 months later)
Interview Questions: Q: What motivates you to work in higher education?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Normal interview questions pertaining to work history and experience. Goals were discussed and work processes.  They were very nice and knowledgeable people and I liked them right away. I enjoyed the interview process.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview that was too long with too many participants.  It doesn't take 7 people to interview for one position.  I also had to meet with several other departments during the process.  Glad I lived locally in Denton so I didn't have far to travel.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to UNT

title: Lab Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the lab administrator, lab manager, and the new lab manager taking over. I was given scenario-based questions during my interview process. I was also asked questions about my resume. I was escorted out with a promise of getting back to me quickly.
Interview Questions: Say there is a line of students waiting to print and one student becomes irate, how would you handle that?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: A group of other executive and upper-level administrative support personnel conducted the first round of interviews.The executive would conduct the next round, but I was not selected to continue to the next stage.
Interview Questions: How I would protect the executive's time and calendar, how I would prepare the executive for each day's business.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the heads of three different departments. It was a panel and they asked questions about my experience. I was also required to take a proofreading test and a copyediting test.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Selected on the basis of your academic qualifications on graduate application to the university. Stellar applications are looked at very favorably. Teaching positions will be based on your academic mastery of a course as demonstrated in the college classes undertaken as an undergraduate
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Tutor, Philosophy Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Showed up and answered questions about my background, my interest in the subject (philosophy) my projects and focuses in the subject, why I wanted to do this work, and what has prepared me to do this work. The interview was simple and the interviewer was very friendly and allowed me to speak as long or quickly as I wanted in response. There was virtually no pressure.
Interview Questions: What prior experience do you have tutoring?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: I signed up for the position toward the end of the semester using the Career Center job search database. The next morning I received a phone call to set up an interview as early as the next day. I interviewed, and I believe the next week I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions, mostly get to know you questions

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was no formal interview. At least for me. I had been in contact with one of my professors discussing some areas that interested me. After showing some initiative and a willingness to learn, he invited me to join his research lab. I would suggest to those who are looking to get into research to contact your favorite professors and see if they are looking for students.
Interview Questions: What areas of research interest you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was asked a few question about computers. we also wen over my class schedule to see what time I could work. I also described all the parts of a computer and explained the 2 computers that I made for a friend. Also having experience with hand tools is a plus
Interview Questions: How many computers have you fixed?

title: Helpdesk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received email within a couple weeks, in person interview week after, offer two weeks later. Process was quite slow. I had to follow up to get any word from the employer.
Interview Questions: Tons of &#034;Describe to me a time you xyz&#034;

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: No interview process at all, you are simply given the position in order to receive benefits. Hiring was straightforward and they used all the information available from your student account to make sure you are properly reimbursed to your own checking account.
Interview Questions: No interview questions to be had

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application through the Eagle Network, I was contacted to come in for an interview. There were 2 rounds: one was with the general manager of the dining hall and the second was with the head supervisor of dining hall services.
Interview Questions:
1. Past work experience?
2. Strengths?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Department Head, who reviewed my qualifications and specified the demands of the position.  We talked about the student body, his goals for the program and how I could help to fulfill his vision.  He determined that I would be a good fit.  We also talked about the format of the classes, exams and papers and what my expectations should be regarding these.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who stops showing up?

title: Engineering Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied and they contacted me for an in person interview. I came and they asked questions about my background, interests, and what I thought of the school. I followed up with a "thank you" email after the interview and they called me within the week.
Interview Questions: What would you change about the College of Engineering?

title: Student Services Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: For general coordinator positions, there is usually a phone screen and then an on-site interview. Interview is very often a one on one interview followed by a group interview. Some interviews might require some sort of presentation.
Interview Questions: What question do you want us to ask you?

title: Writing Lab Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview followed by a test over basic editing skills. I was asked to list Be verbs and edit some short sentences. The actual interview was a simple face to face to get a feel for my personality. Overall it was a very easy interview and made me feel comfortable about working there.
Interview Questions: What are the forms of be?

title: Gift Records Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went in for about an hour long interview. Was called back the next week and offered position. The poeple were really nice. They were very thorough in the range of questions they covered. Were really big on making sure the person understood the roles and challenges of the position very clearly.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you made a mistake

title: Food Supervisor I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired internally so I was just pulled from work at an acceptable time. I was interviewed by the managers first, then director, the the executive. When speaking to executive, always have an answer for every question and stick to your guns when have an opinion. They can bully you a bit but if you don't agree, just disagree. They REALLY like people with confidence.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to be in hospitality?

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with basic interview questions
Interview Questions: What do you expect from a supervisor?

title: Administrative Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: There were two interview sessions with a question and scenario basis.  Intense but able to provide sufficient feedback.
Interview Questions: Scenario based questions can be challenging. Not having specific details about a scenario can make it challenging to know what would be expected.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process can be easy and difficult depending on whet department you're in. The key is to be persistent with the department. The Rules have changed for this year, but part of my tuition was paid along with a monthly stipend.
Interview Questions: What interest you in this position? And what do you want to gain?

title: Computer Lab Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: First there is phone interview, after that there is face to face interview with boss and after that there is an interview with team leads. After that boss does proper work for you with University of North Texas.
Interview Questions: Technical questions like what if a costumer comes to you with monitor issue or printer issue. What would you do? Also general questions like your weakness and strength

title: Student Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty straight forward and predictable. 
1st Interview - Was a panel phone interview. 4-6 people asking general questions, mixed traditional, hypothetical and behavioral. 

2nd Interview - Presentation to the office on a relevant topic to their mission. The presentation was followed by a LARGE panel interview with 10-12 participants. It was pretty enjoyable for me. Again, a mix of traditional, hypothetical and behavioral questions. Following the panel was a one on one "conversational" interview with dept. directors.

The entire process was not quick, but not unnecessarily long either. Currently, time to fill at UNT seems to be much longer.
Interview Questions: None. I researched the dept. and had relevant work experience. The questions were all questions most professionals have been asked before. Nothing bad, but nothing innovative either.

title: Orientation Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and did a phone interview within a couple of weeks. They called me back the same day and arranged to fly me out. The first night I had dinner with the team and the next day I met with several different groups (students, other student affairs staff, etc) of varying sizes. For one session, I had to present a training session to the student group. Everyone was nice.
Interview Questions: What do you think your biggest challenge would be?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the university. I received a phone call where I was asked questions about my qualifications then they asked me to come in to interview. I went in and interviewed.
Interview Questions: What qualifications do you have that qualify you to be a tutor?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, fairly short process (10 mins, tops). The academic coordinator interviews you in her office. She can appear intimidating, but she is really just trying to make sure you are the right kind of person for the job. She checks your transcript to see which classes you earned an "A" in. These are the classes you are qualified to tutor. She gives you a few real-life situations that occur in the job and asks how you would react.
Interview Questions: If a student is staring at the wall while they are supposed to be taking a quiz, what should you do?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas
Interview Descriptions: Group interview- Social- Private interview
Interview Questions: Lots of difficult questions

title: ESL Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Very prompt and professional.
Interview Questions: How would you teach writing skills to beginner-level students?

title: UNT IELI English Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was required to do a teaching demo for about 10 minutes. There were about 3-4 administrators that came to the demo. After the demo, they asked me questions about why I wanted to work at IELI and how I would teach certain grammar points or reading skills. (I think it was transitive verbs and inference questions)
Interview Questions: How would you teach transitive verbs to students

title: Assistant Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: This interview process was a two step process. Part one was a Skype interview and part two was an in person interview. This was all set up via email and correspondence was via email and phone. There is also a mini tour while on campus.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UNT?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX)
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't really a whole lot of questions being asked at the interview. I was one of the only people who contacted her about the position and I was fully qualified so I received the job the same day.
Interview Questions: None

title: Technical Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Fort Worth, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: A 2 on one interview where my technical interests and abilities were assessed. Hiring managers were friendly and made an effort to speak on shared interests. Very easy, very low pressure if you're competent. Don't worry about dressing too fancy. Just dress neatly.
Interview Questions: Can you name the inside components of a computer?

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with the other HR Managers and Director in a group setting.  This came after a phone screening with the Director.  The decisions came pretty quickly after the interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience with hiring.

title: Disability Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hired by former Provost
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Provide a case situation and find a solution for them based on school website. Second interview is ask behavior questions and past working experience
Interview Questions: The length of the school application process

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process is typical for application for a staff position at a University in the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex. You can submit resume, cover letter, and references to the university's human resources website. From there you have no real information about the hiring managers and you basically wait and hope they call--sometimes they don't.

The interviews were decent, however. I received a phone interview in which I was asked a number of seemingly preliminary questions. I gathered it was more to check for things like, phone voice, etc.

The in-person interview was much more in-depth. I was asked questions about my fundraising philosophies and my professional experience.
Interview Questions: I don't think any of the questions were particularly difficult, however, the most unexpected was "What do you think should be the goal of the Annual Fund; to increase dollars or increase donors?"

title: Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: first you get contacted by email than youa re set up for 1:! interview
Interview Questions: none  theres was a skill test

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview is a three step process. First you must make the paper cuts. Then from there you have to go through a group interview. During the group interview you have to try to make an impression to those around you. The next step is 1-on-1 interviews with individual Hall Directors.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were in a difficult situation and how did you solve it?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was more about ones personality and philosophy because of the nature of the position. It's a very sensitive position so the management needs to be able to trust you during the interview. They were very friendly and not intimidating at all.
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy of customer service?

title: Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call within the week to schedule an interview. Some of the questions were kind of challenging, especially since I was a freshman at the time. I thought I had done pretty poorily, but received a call later that day offering me the position. After I had been hired, the managment changed and now the inerview process is much more difficult. It requires and online application as well as a supplemental application that you pick up in person.
Interview Questions: Honestly, just have examples of when you received goos customer service and explain what good customer service means to you

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: it is interesting that the educational psychology department did not require an interview for teaching assistant. It is mainly based on your previous research experiences. Some faculties who know you and your capacities may have a private talk with you and invites you to be his/her research assistant.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call about 2 weeks after I had applied online. Panel interview and series of different interviews. Each person asked a series of interview questions. I was contacted in a couple of days with a job offer. I gladly accepted.
