Interview Questions: What do you consider your biggest weakness?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Telephonic interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
It was more application based to get into the graduate school, and I was offered a TA position based on my undergraduate experience, GPA, and GRE scores. 
Selecting a research advisor required a bit of an interview - primarily ensuring research interests were aligned, checking GRE scores, etc. Also a meeting with the students in the research group was requested to ensure compatibility with the group.
Interview Questions: Why did you come to UNT?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very behavioral and simple. It lasted 30 minutes top. The questions were more-so behavioral as the situations you deal with are with one-on-one interaction with students essentially serving as the first faces they contact or see when seeking help from administrative departments.
Interview Questions: What would you do in case an unhappy student called and started speaking in a very distressed manner, how would you handle this situation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Get accepted by the Phd program first. Telephone interview first and then campus interview after a couple of weeks if you are selected as potential candidate. Talk to professors, staff workers and current Phd students during the campue interview. No technique questions just general question.
Interview Questions: Why Phd? Why finance

title: Administration Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: My interview with Lydia Fleming, who I don't believe works for the same department unfortunately, was very low stress and laid back. I was asked the usual questions about relevant background experience and was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself? Do you have experience with Microsoft Office? Tell me about your past work experience.

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was clear on explaining what they were looking for in the vacant role. The hiring manager presented many situational type questions to see how I would react in various situations.  The hiring manager presented questions on basic concepts that anyone working in my line of work should know.
Interview Questions: How much experience did I have in the field. I was also presented with in depth questions about the skills listed on my resume.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The only way to apply for a position is online. Most important part is the proper resume, as it's scanned electronically for keywords appearing on the job description. So, if you have a generic resume, make it match the position description or it will not even be considered. There will be a phone interview, panel interview consisting of lower to mid management and couple experts with the same position title for which you applied. It's a big plus to have something to show to speak for your expertise - some project that you worked on, don't be afraid to bring your laptop with you. Be on time, be confident, dress nice. Good working knowledge of SQL, Java and Unix systems will put you at a greater advantage.
Interview Questions: Are you a quick learner?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Once you are accepted to be a graduate student you get some type of job. TA, Grader, work in CCIL, CRC, prep-er, ect. 

The main thing is to have 2 or more recommendation letters from CHEMISTRY professors or CHEMISTRY professionals. If you can get them from people with in the UNT chemistry department then that is even better. There is no real interview process but there is an application process.
Interview Questions: The main thing is to have 2 or more recommendation letters from CHEMISTRY professors or CHEMISTRY professionals. If you can get them from people with in the UNT chemistry department then that is even better. There is no real interview process but there is an application process.

title: Computer Lab Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: They had a sign outside the computer lab, I called and met with the person in charge right away. They asked me some simple questions about my ability to run programs and hired me on the spot.
Interview Questions: Can you run Adobe programs like Bridge, InDesign, Photoshop?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: pretty easy just be yourself. they don't ask a lot of hard questions. Basic questions like what are you studying, are you punctual, how we'll do you work with others, can you multi task have you ever uses certain programs and its mostly microsft programs. you should be pretty familiar with if you are o student of any kind.
Interview Questions: none if you know how to work in a office

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Denton, TX) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit all the required documents and then I got a call from the department and I was asked different questions based on my research experiences during my internships.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of North Texas (Fort Worth, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and they called me for interview.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of North Texas in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone screen with the director then a week late I met in person interview with the director.  After that I had a panel interview with the Director and the 3 Assistant Directors.  I had to go to the University and meet with the department.  Biggest issue was finding parking in a place I had never been.  I was offered and accepted the position.
Interview Questions: How do you work in an environment where people don't like you (HR)?
